rev.comment: the official name is not "ubuntu linux"
rev.diff:
Line 1: Line 1: â
'''Ubuntu Netbook Remix''' is an official distribution of [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu Linux]] for [[netbook]]s, optimized for those using the [[Intel Atom]] processor.<ref name=canonical>[http://www.ubuntu.com/news/netbook-remix Canonical Showcases Ubuntu Netbook Remix at Computex | Ubuntu<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> It is based on the standard Ubuntu Desktop distribution, but adds a window picker and an application launcher optimized for netbooks.<ref>[http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20080604-hands-on-with-the-ubuntu-netbook-remix.html Hands on with the Ubuntu Netbook Remix<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[Canonical Ltd.|Canonical]], the company that backs Ubuntu, is collaborating with [[Moblin Linux|Moblin]] (Mobile Linux Internet Project) to ensure optimization for lower hardware requirements and higher battery life. Ubuntu Netbook Remix will be available to the public, with optional audio and video decoders for OEMs<ref name="official">{{cite web|url=http://www.canonical.com/netbooks|title=Ubuntu Netbook Remix|publisher=[[Canonical, Ltd.]]|accessdate=2008-06-23}}</ref>. The first devices using Netbook Remix are scheduled to be released in late 2008. Development version of Ubuntu Netbook Remix is available at [[Launchpad.net|Launchpad]] as [[Personal Package Archive]] for the standard Ubuntu Desktop 8.04.
+
'''Ubuntu Netbook Remix''' is an official distribution of [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]] for [[netbook]]s, optimized for those using the [[Intel Atom]] processor.<ref name=canonical>[http://www.ubuntu.com/news/netbook-remix Canonical Showcases Ubuntu Netbook Remix at Computex | Ubuntu<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> It is based on the standard Ubuntu Desktop distribution, but adds a window picker and an application launcher optimized for netbooks.<ref>[http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20080604-hands-on-with-the-ubuntu-netbook-remix.html Hands on with the Ubuntu Netbook Remix<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> [[Canonical Ltd.|Canonical]], the company that backs Ubuntu, is collaborating with [[Moblin Linux|Moblin]] (Mobile Linux Internet Project) to ensure optimization for lower hardware requirements and higher battery life. Ubuntu Netbook Remix will be available to the public, with optional audio and video decoders for OEMs<ref name="official">{{cite web|url=http://www.canonical.com/netbooks|title=Ubuntu Netbook Remix|publisher=[[Canonical, Ltd.]]|accessdate=2008-06-23}}</ref>. The first devices using Netbook Remix are scheduled to be released in late 2008. Development version of Ubuntu Netbook Remix is available at [[Launchpad.net|Launchpad]] as [[Personal Package Archive]] for the standard Ubuntu Desktop 8.04.
